snippet: The Environmental Protection Agency failed to consistently disclose health risks, including possible cancer risks, to research study participants who were exposed to dangerous pollutants, an agency watchdog report has found.
abstract: Environmental Protection Agency inspector general's report finds that the agency failed to consistently disclose health risks, including possible cancer risks, to research study participants who were exposed to dangerous air pollutants.
lead_paragraph: The Environmental Protection Agency failed to consistently disclose health risks, including possible cancer risks, to research study participants who were exposed to dangerous pollutants, an agency watchdog report has found.

headline.main: E.P.A. Faulted for Failure to Report Risks
headline.print_headline: E.P.A. Faulted for Failure to Report Risks
